tool_description: Establishes connection to vehicle's OBD-II port and verifies system readiness for diagnostic communication.

connection_type.description: Type of OBD connection interface (bluetooth, wifi, usb, professional)

vehicle_protocol.description: OBD protocol to use (auto, iso9141, kwp2000, can, vpw, pwm)

error_messages: Connection failed: Check that OBD adapter is properly connected to vehicle port and powered on.
Vehicle not ready: Engine must be running or ignition in ON position for diagnostic communication.
Unsupported protocol: Use one of [auto, iso9141, kwp2000, can, vpw, pwm] or leave as auto for detection.
usage: Connect OBD adapter to vehicle port, ensure ignition is on, then specify connection_type. Optionally set vehicle_protocol if automatic detection fails.

connection_status.description: Status of OBD connection (connected, failed, timeout)

system_readiness.description: Whether vehicle systems are ready for diagnostic queries
